Title: Upper Hemel-en-Aarde Chardonnay 2022
Teaser: The lively combination of subtle oak and bright fruit exhibits aromas of white flowers, citrus, pear and brioche.
Content:
A lightly oaked wine that tastes of butterscotch and pear and will go well with roast chicken or a creamy seafood pasta.

The cooled grapes are hand sorted , destemmed and pressed settle and clear overnight. 15% of the settled juice is then fermented and matured in new French ceramic toasted oak for 8 months which retained the bright fruit aromas. Only partial spontaneous malolactic fermentation occurred in the barrels.

Pale gold. The lively combination of subtle oak and bright fruit exhibits aromas of white flowers, citrus, pear and brioche. Beautiful mouth feel with a long creamy finish.

VARIETAL: Chardonnay 100%.

Upper Hemel-en-Aarde Chardonnay 2022 Tasting Note

Title: Generation 8 Cabernet Sauvignon 2023
Teaser: “Our family has an affinity to Cabernet Sauvignon,” explains CEO, Petrus Bosman. “My grandfather believed that by blending a small portion of Cabernet into a red wine, it would take that wine to a whole new level.”
Content:
Grapes are hand harvested and destemmed before the onset of fermentation. Pumpovers are utilized for colour extraction. Before alcoholic fermentation is complete, it is pressed to make sure that the tannin expression is fine and subtle. A portion of the wine is matured in new French oak for 4 months to create a complex wine with supple supple tannins.

Crimson with a purple edge. Beautiful blackberry and raspberry aromas are rounded out by a long, fresh, fruit-packed finish. A velvety mouth-feel with a fruity, lingering finish. 

VARIETAL: 100% Cabernet Sauvignon.

Generation 8 Cabernet Sauvignon 2023 Tasting Note

Title: Pét Nat Weisser Riesling 2023
Teaser: This wine smells like a soft spring day in the Cape mountains. Aromas of fresh green apple, white peach, and fragrant blossoms dominate.
Content:
Despite its recent surge in popularity, Pétillant Naturel wines are far from a new fad. This sparkler, dates back pre-Champagne, where the wine is bottled prior to fully completing its first fermentation, allowing carbon dioxide to be produced in the enclosed bottle by the natural sugars found in the grapes. 

Only, it isn’t actually Pétillant Naturel this time. While the method of production is exactly the same, the wine ended up with more bubbles, and therefore is classed as a Méthode Ancestrale instead. But we’ve got used to saying Pet Nat, so we’ll stick to that name for now. 

The Upper Hemel-en-Aarde valley 2023 vintage will be remembered for the search for picking windows in a wet season. Overall yields were down compared with the previous, above-average crop, influenced by uneven budding as well as late-season rot. The inclement weather notwithstanding, the valley’s flagship cultivars areof outstanding quality with expectations of balanced wines with low alcohols, good acidity and high aromatic potential.

This wine smells like a soft spring day in the Cape mountains. Aromas of fresh green apple, white peach, and fragrant blossoms dominate. On the palate, the wine calls to mind honeyed pears with herbal notes and a floral minerality.

VARIETAL: 100% Weisser Riesling
SEO Description: Despite its recent surge in popularity, Pétillant Naturel wines are far from a new fad. This sparkler, dates back pre-Champagne, where the wine is...

Teaser: Medium bodied palate where soft tannins contribute to a fine structure. A balanced wine with a lingering, memorable finish.

Vibrant purple heart with cerise rim. Rich, bright fresh berries, a slight earthiness and subtle spicy notes. Medium bodied palate where soft tannins contribute to a fine structure. A balanced wine with a lingering, memorable finish. 

VARIETAL: 100% Pinot Noir.

Title: Méthode Ancestrale Weisser Riesling 2022
Content:
Despite its recent surge in popularity, Pétillant Naturel wines are far from a new fad. This sparkler, dates back pre-Champagne, where the wine is bottled prior to fully completing its first fermentation, allowing carbon dioxide to be produced in the enclosed bottle by the natural sugars found in the grapes. 

Only, it isn’t actually Pétillant Naturel this time. While the method of production is exactly the same, the wine ended up with more bubbles, and therefore is classed as a Méthode Ancestrale instead. But we’ve got used to saying Pet Nat, so we’ll stick to that name for now. 

Every vintage, winemaker Corlea Fourie designs the label herself, and so far she has featured the fields of fynbos in which the vineyards find themselves. 

This wine smells like a soft spring day in the Cape mountains. On the palate, the wine calls to mind honeyed pears with herbal notes and a floral minerality. A luscious wine to enjoy as an aperitif on its own or paired with canapes such as smoked salmon or grilled peaches and prosciutto or perhaps a steaming bowl of creamy mussels. 

VARIETAL: 100% Weisser Riesling

Title: Generation 8 Chenin Blanc 2023
Teaser: The components of this wine are from different sites planted on decomposed granite in the Bovlei, parcels on schist on our farm close to Hermon and components from our Voor-Paardeberg farm. From young fruit-driven vineyards to older, more elegant ones, all are sensitively blended together for the best result.
Content:
Two components of Chenin worth noting are: Firstly, the 1.7% Chenin made by drying the grapes in the sun for a week, before pressing and then fermenting. The component does add a small amount of residual sugar to the wine -but it primarily adds to the generosity of the flavour spectrum. The second notable component of 3.7% skin contact adds texture and structure to the wine. Both components are utilized to add appeal in terms of its adaptability with food and food enjoyment.

Pale green. Delicate nuances of pear and peach are balanced on the palate with a sumptuous, lingering finish. Medium to full-bodied style with a long, clean, crisp aftertaste. 

VARIETAL: 92% Chenin Blanc 5% Grenache blanc, 3% Viognier.

Generation 8 Chenin Blanc 2022 Tasting Note

Title: Chasing Rabbits Organic Grenache Blanc 2021
Teaser:
The Grenache blanc vineyard is called Kleinplasie (small farm) as it indicates a smallholding from a
time long ago. The current vineyard was planted in 2011.
Content:
Harvested on 8 February 2021. Destemmed and pressed into 0stainless steel tank. Natural fermentation with no malolactic fermentation. No addition of acidity or oaking and no skin contact involved. As our journey with Grenache has always been led by skin contact- this rendition sought the expression of clarity of fruit.  

Medium to light yellow with golden rim. Pithy citrus, yellow prunes, pear and spice. Light to medium style with a lively and generous finish.  

VARIETAL:  100% Grenache Blanc.

Title: Generation 8 Merlot 2023
Teaser: A true classic. A medium bodied wine with an appealing bouquet of ripe cherries and mulberries, followed through with hints of earthiness and plums on the palate.  A wine packed with red fruit and a lingering aftertaste.
Content:
Grapes are hand harvested and destemmed before fermentation occurs. Regular pump-overs ensure good colour extraction and a gentle pressing results in tannin expression that is fine and subtle.  

A portion of the wine is matured in new French oak for 6 months to create a complex wine with supple tannins.  

A true classic. A medium bodied wine with an appealing bouquet of ripe cherries and mulberries, followed through with hints of earthiness and plums on the palate. A wine packed with red fruit and a lingering aftertaste. A good partner to a range of tomato-based dishes, roast chicken and creamy mushroom steak or stews. 

VARIETAL: 100% Merlot.

Title: Bosman Erfenis 2018
Teaser: The Bosman Erfenis Cape Blend is one such wine. It is a wine that commemorates, defines and sets a standard for the Bosman cellar, the Wellington region and the Cape Winelands at large. And it has earned the accolades to prove just that.
Content:
The Bosman Erfenis Cape Blend is one such wine. It is a wine that commemorates, defines and sets a standard for the Bosman cellar, the Wellington region and the Cape Winelands at large. And it has earned the accolades to prove just that. 

Deep purple red with a youthful vibrant rim. Deep, concentrated aromas of blackberry and red fruit. The oak lends integrated spicy notes, the flavours develop well in the glass or by decanting. Complex secondary flavours accented by lovely spicy notes from maturation in oak. 

VARIETAL: 50% Cabernet Sauvignon , 20% Cinsaut , 30% Nero D`Avola.

Title: Bosman Cabernet Sauvignon 2016
Content:
The Bosman Cabernet Sauvignon has always been a stalwart on our farm. The grapes for this wine were harvested from older vineyards which have produced consistent superior quality over decades.

Deep berry red with a garnet rim, elegant raspberry, blackberry and concentrated plum aromas. Slight pencil shaving notes, beautiful mouth feel with a long fruit-crammed, persistent finish. Tannins are subtle and accessible.

Bosman Cabernet Sauvignon 2016 Tasting Note

Title: Optenhorst Chenin Blanc 2013
Teaser: Investec Trophy Wine Show winner, Bosman Optenhorst Chenin Blanc 2013 was awarded the trophy for Best Museum Class Chenin Blanc!
Content:
Investec Trophy Wine Show winner, Bosman Optenhorst Chenin Blanc 2013 was awarded the trophy for Best Museum Class Chenin Blanc!

The Optenhorst Chenin Blanc features in our Special Vineyard Selection - those wines which speak of a place where it is rooted. In this Chenin Blanc`s case it has been rooted in a specific site since 1952. In 2010 the Chenin Blanc Association funded research into the old vineyards of the Cape. It turned out the Optenhorst vineyard is the fourth oldest in the country. 

We believe that Wellington and indeed the Bovlei Valley will one day be renowned for the quality of its Chenin and the longevity thereof. We also believe that Optenhorst will lead the way. 

Pale straw with vibrant golden rim. Beautiful restraint mouth feel. Finishes with lively, mineral accent. 

VARIETAL: 100% Chenin Blanc.

Title: Generation 8 Shiraz 2023
Teaser: A confident wine with fine textures of pepper spice, tobacco, new leather, with plums and brambles. A concentrated wine with a refreshing finish.
Content:
Our Shiraz sites range from plantings from 2001 to as young as 2013, including vineyards near Hermon, planted in Schist soils, and vineyards in the Bovlei in decomposed granite. A new addition since 2022 is grapes from our Voor-Paardeberg farm contributing beautiful black pepper spice. 

Grapes are hand harvested and destemmed before fermentation onset. Pumpovers are utilized for colour extraction. Before alcoholic fermentation is complete, the must is pressed to make sure that the tannin expression is fine and subtle. A portion of the wine is matured in new French oak for 6 months to create a complex wine with supple tannins. 

A confident wine with fine textures of pepper spice, tobacco, new leather, with plums and brambles. A concentrated wine with a refreshing finish.  

VARIETAL: 100% Shiraz. 

Generation Shiraz 2023 Tasting Note

Title: Generation 8 Rosé 2022
Teaser: Notes of wild strawberries and cranberries with a fresh finish. The Cinsaut is evident in the structure and texture. This Rosé is a wine with fantastic culinary appeal.
Content:
Harvested with the sole intent to produce a Rosè - the Cinsaut is hand harvested and then vinified to the desired modest alcohol level and fresh, lively acidity. Limited skin contact results in the rosy hue. The grapes are pressed and then treated like a white wine to secure as much of the freshness as possible. 

Rosy Pink. Hints of strawberries and fresh spring flowers. Notes of wild strawberries and cranberries with a fresh finish. The Cinsaut is evident in the structure and texture. This Rosé is a wine with fantastic culinary appeal. 

VARIETAL: Cinsaut.

Generation 8 Rose 2022 Tasting Note

Title: Adama White 2023
Teaser: Adama is an innovative white wine, a blend of two varietals that thrive in our local climate. It is an authentic rendition of elegant, modern winemaking, paying homage to the rich heritage of the families on the farm.
Content:
The Chenin comes from a vineyard called Draai-Draai (‘turn-turn’ in English), as this site lies within a narrow valley and the tractor drivers really need dexterity to negotiate their winding route. 

The Grenache Blanc comes from higher elevations on decomposed granite soils which finishes the blend with brightness and clarity. All of the Chenin was matured in French oak for 7 months of which 10% of the wood maturation was in new barriques. Just before bottling the blend is made up, differing every year depending on the strengths of the components. 

A crisp, golden yellow heart. White nectarine and slight green pineapple aromas are supported by a mixture of pithiness, almond and a touch of butterscotch. Generous flavours of stone fruit and marzipan develop in the glass while the finish is lively with mineral accents.

Varietal: 85% Chenin Blanc and 15% Grenache Blanc.

Title: Optenhorst Chenin Blanc 2022
Teaser: Made from the 3rd oldest Chenin Blanc vineyard in the country, this gracious ‘grande dame’ expresses flavours of stone fruit, citrus and almond brittle in a refined and restrained manner.
Content:
Made from the 3rd oldest Chenin Blanc vineyard in the country, this gracious ‘grande dame’ expresses flavours of stone fruit, citrus and almond brittle in a refined and restrained manner.

Whole A cooler and wet winter gave the vines ample time to rest and build up reserves. Moderate temperatures also allowed the grapes to have a longer ripening period on the vine whilst producing wines that are fresh, lively and flavourful.  

Whole-bunch pressed, settled overnight and the clear juice drawn off in the morning. Spontaneous fermentation occurred in both a concrete tank and French oak barrels. The wine matured in these vessels for 8 months to build mouthfeel whilst retaining freshness.

Pale straw with vibrant golden rim. On the nose, this wine exudes enticing aromas of ripe orchard fruits, such as succulent baked apples and white pear. Hints of toasted almonds, fresh ginger and a delicate vanilla presence from the oak aging adds richness. 

VARIETAL: Chenin Blanc 100%.

Optenhorst Chenin Blanc 2022 Tasting Note

Title: Twyfeling Cinsaut 2021
Teaser: Cinsaut was one of the cornerstone varieties in the Bovlei valley in the previous century. This wine is a toast to rediscovering what the old farmers deemed fit for the valley we call home.
Content:
An old-fashioned wine with a modern edge. This 5 star wine will impress the best!

This is our humble (and modern) take on what a Wellington bush vine Cinsaut could look like.  The vineyard is harvested in 3 components, picked only days apart. The grapes are hand sorted, de-stemmed and slightly crushed. Spontaneous fermentation is facilitated with daily punch downs and pump overs. A total of 10% of the wine fermented as a whole bunch component and 10% with stem contact to add freshness and complexity. The wine spent extended time on the skins after fermentation. Followed by a 12 month maturation period in 225L and 500L French oak barrels. The 2021 vintage saw 12% new oak. Gently filtered.

Deep plum centre with purple rim. Lovely fresh berry flavours with hints of tobacco, spice and savoury notes. Luscious and concentrated although of medium body. A bold wine with an elegant structure.

VARIETAL: Cinsaut 100%.

Twyfeling Cinsaut 2021 Tasting Note

An old-fashioned wine with a modern edge. This 5 star wine will impress the best!

Title: Fides Grenache Blanc 2019
Teaser:
The Bosman orange wine, Fides, is made from a single vineyard of Grenache Blanc which is naturally fermented.  

The name Fides is taken from the Bosman family motto: ‘Fides, Spes et Amor’ meaning Faith, Hope and Love. Fides reminds us of the trust necessary between people and nature to craft something truly remarkable.
Content:
This show-stopping orange wine was made according to a 6000-year-old tradition. The Fides Grenache Blanc 2019 wine was naturally fermented and matured in neutral vessels.

Complex dried, waxy orange peel, marzipan with secondary fruit characters. Instead of simply tasting fruit or flowers this wines tastes of bruised apple, por pourri and candied peel.

VARIETAL: Grenache Blanc (Skin Contact).

Fides Grenache Blanc 2019 Tasting Note

Title: Triple T 2020 | Limited Edition
Content:
It is a blend of a barrel each of Tannat, Touriga Franca and Tinta Barocca, hence the jaunty name Triple T.

Tannat, orginally from France and now planted prolifically in Uruguay, is very rare in South Africa, but, as you know, the Bosman Adama Vine Nursery propagates the country’s grafted vines, and so we have little pockets of almost every wine varietal you can think of … every adventurous winemaker’s dream and Corlea’s happy place.

So, she blended the Tannat with two Portuguese Port varieties to create a rich, dark wine with a bouquet of dark fruit, dried herbs, sweet spices and velvety tannins, the perfect wine for a cosy winter meal.

VARIETAL: Tannat 55%, Touriga Franca 27%, Tinta Barocca 18%.

It is a blend of a barrel each of Tannat, Touriga Franca and Tinta Barocca, hence the jaunty name Triple T.

Title: Upper Hemel-en-Aarde Sauvignon Blanc 2023
Teaser:
Beautiful mouth feel with a long fruit packed finish. 

An ideal aperitif but it also pairs well with a green vegetable medley, seafood, goat’s cheese or crisp salads.
Content:
This wine expresses keenly its cool climate origins exhibiting fruity flavours balanced by flinty, botanical accents that remind one of ‘fynbos’.

The cooled grapes are hand-sorted, destemmed and pressed to settle and clear overnight.  The settled juice is then inoculated and fermented at cool temperatures to ensure complex compounded flavours that develop over an extended fermentation period.   Components are blended two months prior to bottling. 

A vibrant green heart with a lime green rim. 

VARIETAL: 100% Sauvignon Blanc.

Title: Nature & Sun Grenache Noir 2023
Teaser: Nature and Sun is the wine range in which Bosman Family Vineyards explore Organic winemaking. It fits the Bosman philosophy well as it is a production system that sustains and regenerates soils and ecosystems. It relies on our environment, on biodiversity and it seeks to plant what is deemed best in local conditions and to adapt systems to support this. It combines tradition, innovation and science and its goal is a better life for all.
Content:
The Grenache noir vineyard is called Gesamentlike Wei (communal pasture) and was planted in 2016.

Hand harvested on 8th of  March 2022. Destemmed to stainless steel tank. Natural fermentation, with pressing at 5° balling (total time on skins 3 days). Uninoculated malolactic fermentation. No additions of acidity. Unoaked. The intention was seeking the fine tension and clarity of young vine-fruit, whilst exploring the specific imprint organic viticulture would have on expression.

Ruby medium, to light colour with garnet rim. Delicate violet, raspberry and red plum. Some notes of scrub, almost hoppy. Light to medium style with a lively finish. 

VARIETAL: 100% Grenache Noir.

The Grenache noir vineyard is called Gesamentlike Wei (communal pasture) and was planted in 2016.

Title: Magnum Opus Pinot Noir 2019
Teaser: The term ‘magnum opus’ describes a work of art, music or literature that is regarded as the best most important or best work that an artist, composer or writer has produced. This wine, made with exquisite care from Pinot Noir vineyards grown in the cool reaches of the Upper Hemel-en-Aarde Valley, represents our best offering.
Content:
The term ‘magnum opus’ describes a work of art, music or literature that is regarded as the best most important or best work that an artist, composer or writer has produced. This wine, made with exquisite care from Pinot Noir vineyards grown in the cool reaches of the Upper Hemel-en-Aarde Valley, represents our best offering.

A complex nose with a combination of dark plums and blueberries with luscious hints of fruitcake. This is the only vineyard of Pinot noir from our farm which displays this specific profile –an attribute we link to the site`s high elevation. The oak lends more tertiary flavours, but the core remains fruit forward and bright.

A gentle opulence on the palate, lovely fine tannins, and a generous finish.

VARIETAL: 100% Pinot Noir.

Magnum Opus Pinot Noir 2019 Tasting Note

Title: Weisser Riesling 2021 | Wine Club Selection
Teaser:
A fine green colour with a warm yellow glow. Lemons, green apple, spice and pressed flowers. 
Luscious and concentrated although medium-bodied. The aromas on the nose follow through to the palate, accentuated by the residual sugar. This a truly food friendly wine, its vibrant acidity is a good foil for rich, spicy dishes.
Content:
In 2000 the family acquired a vineyard in the Upper Hemel-en-Aarde Valley which would supplement their offering with cool climate grapes. 

Here the vineyards are planted between fields of indigenous ‘fynbos’ and in close proximity to the sea. 

Ideal soil types combine with cooling breezes to create terroir rivalling the world's best; and resulting in wines with minerality, elegance, vivacity and finesse. 

VARIETAL: 100% Weisser Riesling 

Weisser Riesling 2021 Tasting Note

Title: Nero 2020
Teaser: Bosman Nero is the first and only wine to be made from the Sicilian red grape Nero d’ Avola in South Africa. So it is perhaps the most unique of the Mediterranean varietals to be grown locally.
Content:
Bosman Nero is the first and only wine to be made from the Sicilian red grape Nero d’ Avola in South Africa. So it is perhaps the most unique of the Mediterranean varietals to be grown locally. 

At the turn of the 21st century when it was clear climate change was becoming a reality and it was evident that the Cape Winelands would become a hotter, drier place, the Bosmans struck out to find a grape that would thrive in Wellington’s increasingly hot, dry climate. 

The grapes were hand-picked, hand-sorted, destemmed and lightly crushed. The juice was allowed to macerate on the grape skins for 2 days prior to fermentation. After the onset of fermentation, regular punch downs extracted maximum colour. The wine spent 3 weeks on the skins before being pressed. Barrel maturation lasted for 18 months in a combination of 20% new French oak as well as 2nd and 3rd fill barrels. The barrels were meticulously selected for this vintage. After blending the selected barrels, the wine was allowed to mature for a few months to ensure a balanced, well-rounded result.

Lovely fresh red berry aromas with hints of spice. A generous palate with a luscious concentration of fruit, a good tannin structure and a lingering finish.

VARIETAL: 100% Nero d' Avola.

Nero 2020 Tasting Note

Title: Loose Cannon Cap Classique 2021
Teaser: We all know one, a Loose Cannon: Someone who is likely to say something explosive at the most inappropriate moment. This bubbly has such a character: Handle with care.
Content:
We all know one, a Loose Cannon: Someone who is likely to say something explosive at the most inappropriate moment. This bubbly has such a character: Handle with care. 

The base wine was whole bunch pressed at a low sugar level to enable a second bottle fermentation. This wine was barrel fermented and then left on the lees for 6 months, spending another 8 months in tank prior to bottling. Second fermentation commenced in the bottle and the wine was matured for a further 17 months before disgorgement. A small portion of the wine was made from Chenin Blanc grapes that were left to dry naturally in the sun, adding a natural sweetness for balance and complexity. 

A delightful golden colour with a pale heart, hinting at a beautifully matured Cap Classique.

A wine finely balance between generosity and restraint with aromas of Granny Smith apples and fine notes of dried peach and honeyed brioche.

Loose Cannon Cap Classique 2021 Tasting Note

Title: Adama Red 2021
Teaser: Adama is an innovative red wine boasting a skilful blend of unusual varietals that thrive in our local climate. It is an authentic rendition of elegant, modern winemaking, paying homage to the rich heritage of the families on the farm.
Content:
All 8 components of this innovative blend have been vinified separately to preserve & express the unique characteristics of each varietal. The 15% new oak not only complements the generous fruit aromas on the nose but contributes to the structure of the wine as well. The Shiraz is matured in a combination of new American and French oak. While the rest of the wines are matured in second to fifth fill French oak. Just before bottling the blend is made up, differing every year depending on the strengths if the components.

Generous flavours of plums, dark cherries and chocolate develop in the glass while the finish is lively with mineral accents.

VARIETAL:  Shiraz 62%, Mourvedre 14%, Cinsaut 7%, Grenache Noir 5.5%, Primitivo 5.5%, Nero D'Avola 4%, Tempranillo 1%, Durif 1%.

Adama Red 2021 Tasting Note
